newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Plutonic signs A$350 mln debt facility.
newsitem.headline: Plutonic signs A$350 mln debt facility.

text.p: Gold miner Plutonic Resources Ltd said on Tuesday it has signed for a A$350 million syndicated debt facility.

Plutonic said the facility would be used to refinance existing bank debt, capital expansion plans, acquisitions consistent with the company's core business, and for general working capital requirements.
Plutonic said the facility would comprise a A$250 million five year syndicated amortising revolving and an A$100 million 364 day syndicated standby facility.

It said it has appointed ABN AMRO Australia Ltd, the Chase Manhattan Bank and Credit Suisse First Boston to arrange and underwrite the debt facility. A formal facility agreement was expected to be executed shortly, the company said.
